keyTakeAways: Sam Rivers, the bass player of Limp Bizkit, has died.
The band members described Rivers as 'pure magic' and 'the soul in the sound,' emphasizing his irreplaceable role in their music.
Rivers died in 2025, with no official details on location or cause, according to social media posts by bandmates.
Fred Durst expressed deep emotional grief, saying he has shed 'gallons and gallons of tears' and called Rivers a 'talented' and 'unforgettable' presence.
Rivers had a history of heavy drinking leading to liver disease and underwent a liver transplant before rejoining the band in 2018.
Limp Bizkit, formed in Jacksonville, Florida, blends alternative rock, heavy metal, and rap with a distinctive sense of humor.
The band is set to tour Central and South America starting in late November 2025.
Durst mentioned that Rivers shared a love for grunge bands like Mother Love Bone, Alice in Chains, and Stone Temple Pilots, highlighting a shared musical foundation.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Sam Rivers, the bassist of the nu metal band Limp Bizkit, has died, according to social media posts by band members. The band, which emerged in Jacksonville, Florida, in the late 1990s with a fusion of alternative rock, heavy metal, and rap, praised Rivers as 'the soul in the sound' and described his presence as irreplaceable. Rivers had previously left the band in 2015 due to health issues related to heavy drinking and liver disease, underwent a liver transplant, and reconnected with the band in 2018. The band has announced a Central and South America tour starting in late November 2025, continuing their global presence despite the loss. Fred Durst, the band’s lead vocalist, shared personal memories of their early days and expressed deep emotional grief, highlighting Rivers’ musical influence, especially in his ability to convey emotional depth through bass playing. The article underscores Rivers’ legacy and the enduring impact of his work on Limp Bizkit’s music and identity.
title: Limp Bizkit Band Members Say Bass Player Sam Rivers Has Died
